Job Title: Fleet Safety Analyst

Location: Bentonville, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Strategy/Planning, Supply Chain

Description:
The Fleet Safety Manager, Advanced Analytics is an exciting opportunity to join the Fleet Safety division to lead data analytics, dashboard development and KPI visibility to guide areas of the business in timely decision-making efforts. This role will support the efforts in Fleet Safety data sourcing and development of tools to support our journey in world class data mining, product, and visibility. This exciting opportunity will work cross functionally within the Supply Chain environment as well as with 3rd party suppliers from Maintenance, Strategy, Operations, Finance, and our OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturers) partners. You will provide data insights working primarily with Supply Chain, Global Tech, 3rd party equipment providers and Field Associates across the country. The role is based in Bentonville, AR and reports directly to the Senior Director of Fleet Safety. 
You’ll sweep us off our feet if…
You are a storyteller using data insightsYou have experience solving new problems – digging in and finding answers
You are familiar with industry trends to include Supply Chain industry experience around Operations, Maintenance, Strategy and EquipmentYou have experience with Overall Equipment Efficiency, Total Productive Maintenance or Total Cost of OwnershipYou have experience working in multiple business areas/functions/segments You have a strong understanding of statistics with applied experience on analyzing large data setsYou can collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyYou have strong skills in building Dashboards, data visualization and reporting tools such as Power BI and TableauYou can work effectively with internal stakeholdersYou are curious, proactive, and comfortable working in unstructured environmentsAbility to interact effectively in a cross-functional team and great communication skills Have a Bachelor’s degree and 2+ years of experience in data analytics 
You’ll make an impact by…
Advising leadership and partners on data optimization for modeling by supporting priorities and providing a forward-looking lens for the Walmart Transportation teamProviding relevant data sources and analysis for Supply Chain operations by understanding business context, combining industry knowledge and market information


Developing insightful solutions by identifying problems and data innovations for forecasting and streamlining decision support solutionsUsing new technology and data explanation formats to improve processesLeveraging data analysis tools to explore data, develop and test hypotheses, uses data to influence strategic work and build and present insightsAnalyzing stakeholder needs and partner with them to share relevant informationOrganizing thoughts, communicating articulately, confidently, credibly, and concisely on data and it’s storyInterpreting information to quantify the anticipated outcome of Fleet Safety decisionsExplaining the key concepts and features of data analysis methods. Lists the major sources (e.g. tools, dashboards, industry sources etc.) for collecting dataBuilding collaborative relationships with key partners by driving priorities aligned to business goals 
The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.
Benefits & Perks: Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.
Equal Opportunity Employer Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.
Who We AreJoin Walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. Yes, we are the Fortune #1 company. But you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. Join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement. From day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com

Experience Level (if available): Associate
